ARABIC: إِذْ دَخَلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوا۟ سَلَٰمًا قَالَ إِنَّا مِنكُمْ وَجِلُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: When they came in to him, they said, 'Peace!' He said, Truly we are afraid of you.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: When they came to him and said: "Peace," he answered: "Truly we are afraid of you."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: When they came to Abraham they said: "Peace be upon you!" He replied: "Indeed we feel afraid of you."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: who came to him saying, "Peace be with you." Abraham said, "We are afraid of you".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: When the angels came to him and said, “Peace"; he said, “We feel afraid of you.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: When they entered upon him, and said: "Salaman (peace!)." He said: "Indeed we are frightened of you."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: When they entered upon him, they said, Peace. He said: Surely we are afraid of you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: when they entered unto him, saying, 'Peace!' He said, 'Behold, we are afraid of you.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: (How) when they came in unto him, and said: Peace. He said: Lo! we are afraid of you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: when they came to him they greeted him with: "Peace." He said,"We feel afraid of you."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: When they entered unto him, and said; peace! He said: verily we are afraid of you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: when they entered into his presence and said, ‘Peace!’ He said, ‘We are indeed afraid of you.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: When they entered his presence and said, "Peace!" He said, "We feel afraid of you!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: When they entered unto him, and said: Salaman (peace)! [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Indeed! We are afraid of you."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: They entered to him and said: 'Peace' but he replied: 'We are afraid of you'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: When they entered upon him, and said, “Peace.” He said, “We are wary of you.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: When they entered upon him and said, "Peace." [Abraham] said, "Indeed, we are fearful of you."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [15:52] [how] when they entered unto him, and said, ‘Peace!’, that is, [they said] this very word (salām). He, Abraham, said, after having offered them food which they did not eat: ‘Lo! we are afraid of you’.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: ((How) when they came in unto him) unto Abraham, (and said: Peace) they greeted him. (He said) Abraham said to them when they did not touch his food: (Lo! we are afraid of you) we are scared of you.
